Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of Board's decision to deny refugee protection
Procedural_Context: Appeal via judicial review after refugee claim denial
Credibility_Assessment: Claimant's story found lacking in credibility
Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, claims of persecution as Roma and domestic abuse victim
Legal_Provision: IRPA - Convention refugee status, need for protection
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution as a Roma and as a victim of domestic abuse
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of sufficient evidence and credibility issues
Application_Factor: Failure to rebut presumption of state protection
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA provisions on Convention refugees and persons in need of protection
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence of persecution and lack of credibility
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to refugee protection and eligibility
Evidentiary_Issues: Inadequate proof of persecution, inconsistencies in testimony
Procedural_Fairness: No indication of procedural unfairness raised
Credibility_Issues: Claimant's credibility challenged and not established
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness of decision
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada - Federal immigration and refugee law
Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient supporting evidence
